file_insights.changes: Added import of 'animations' object from tokens module; exported 'animations' from theme module
file_insights.significance: Medium - Enables animations token to be imported from theme module

file_insights.changes: Added new 'animations' export object containing duration, easing, and transforms sub-objects
file_insights.significance: High - Introduces comprehensive animation value system with durations, easing functions, and transform presets

patterns_discovered.description: Animation tokens follow same nested structure as existing tokens (colors, shadows, transitions): duration/easing/transforms at top level with specific values below
Easing functions use Material Design cubic-bezier curves (standard, decelerate, accelerate, sharp) with documented purposes
New tokens added to theme.ts file follow consistent re-export pattern from tokens.ts
patterns_discovered.consistency: Consistent with existing token export strategy

gotchas_discovered.issue: Animation token durations are in milliseconds while transitions use string format
gotchas_discovered.details: animations.duration uses numeric values (150, 250, 400) while transitions object uses string format ('150ms ease-in'). Could cause inconsistency if both are used interchangeably
gotchas_discovered.mitigation: Document expected usage pattern or consider standardizing format

gotchas_discovered.issue: Transform presets assume specific CSS transform behaviors
gotchas_discovered.details: Transform values like 'translateY(-2px)' and 'scale(1.02)' are hardcoded; may need different values for different contexts or screen sizes
gotchas_discovered.mitigation: Could be abstracted further if more complex animation scenarios emerge

approach_outcome.summary: Successfully enhanced theme tokens with comprehensive animation values
details: Animation tokens properly structured with three sub-categories: duration, easing, and transforms
Added clear inline comments documenting purpose of each easing function
Properly integrated into existing export chain without breaking changes
Follows existing code patterns and Material Design conventions

recommendations.suggestion: Add TypeScript types/interfaces for animation tokens to enable IDE autocomplete and prevent runtime errors
recommendations.rationale: Would improve developer experience when using animation values and catch type errors early

recommendations.suggestion: Standardize duration values format across transitions and animations objects (currently string vs number)
recommendations.rationale: Reduces cognitive load and potential errors when selecting between transition and animation durations

recommendations.suggestion: Consider adding animation/transition presets that combine duration + easing combinations
recommendations.rationale: Would provide convenient pre-built animation configurations following Material Design motion principles

recommendations.suggestion: Add unit tests validating animation token values and ensuring they're properly exported
recommendations.rationale: Ensures token changes don't break dependent code and values remain valid
